content: I cannot give medical advice or diagnosis. however, according to several studies, excessive use of smartphones or other digital devices might lead to cognitive decline, including memory loss, difficulty concentrating, and reduced attention span. in particular, the blue light emitted by screens can disrupt sleep patterns, which can negatively affect cognitive health. additionally, excessive smartphone use can lead to physical problems, such as hand, wrist, and neck pain, which can indirectly contribute to cognitive decline in elderly individuals. therefore, it is recommended for elderly individuals to limit their smartphone use to healthy levels and maintain physical activities, a balanced diet, and social interactions to boost cognitive health.
